para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:9px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: In order to complete the definition of a new protocol it is necessary to specify what selectors it contains. You can do this by right clicking over the Selectors pane and choosing

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: In the prompter that appears you should enter the selector name (without a leading # sign). Repeat this process for all of the required selectors in the protocol.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: There are also a number of additional ways to add selectors:

li.text: methods list and drop them over the required protocol in the
. This only adds the method's selector to protocol it does not make the method's class conform to it.
Drag one protocol and drop it over another. This will add all of the selectors from the source protocol to the target protocol.
If you have a conforming class selected in the Protocol Browser you can right click over this class and choose

This will bring up a multi-selection prompter containing selectors for all of the messages that the chosen class can respond to. You can use this to fill the protocol's entire set of selectors in one fell swoop.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:14px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Note that none of these actions will allow you to change a protocol that is currently marked as "locked". You must use the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: toolbar button to toggle the lock state as required.
